												-Sigh- This game... Where do I start? Okay. Before you say anything about my playtime, listen. My friend told me that Soccer Manager 2016 came out not too long ago. 2015 was okay even though it had problems, but I was like "hm, let's see what they did with the game". So me and him checked out the game for like an hour. Now, I downloaded the game just so I could write this review. And this is basically what I got from that hour of playtime.First thing that bothered me is the whole "share with friends" thing. Okay. I get it. You want that friends compare the state of their clubs and stuff, BUT STOP TELLING ME TO SHARE EVERYTHING WITH MY FRIENDS THE WHOLE TIME! Jesus, you start the game, why don't you SHARE IT WITH YOUR FRIENDS?! Sign a player, SHARE IT WITH YOUR FRIENDS! Could you PLEASE stop shoving those words in my face, I already said NO! I don't have to share it with my friends, mostly because most of my friends would never play this.Secondly, why did you remove the feature where we could make our own formation? Makes no sense. I want to have some freedom when deciding the team tactics... I'm supposed to be the MANAGER, the creative mind of the club, yet I'm being limited to default formations? Also, the player info doesn't appear as a pop-up... Why? It was fine as it was. It's a small thing, yeah, but it was good as it was.Third point, your team (i.e. West Ham) may win 3-0 against City, but then they will lose against Shrewsbury in the FA Cup 4-0, even when you use the same team that beat City. "Realistic" simulation, huh?I could ignore all of that... But I can't ignore this: THE ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ SHOP.Now, I understand. It's a Free-To-Play game but you still want to make money for the hours of time spent on developing the game. But come on... You LITERALLY can't do ANYTHING without buying stuff from the shop! In FM, you can ask the board for more money. Here, there is no football board, and in order to get money, you have to pay REAL MONEY?!If you want to make money, why not just charge for the game, and not have this BS of a shop system.Although these points have only been negatives, I like the game, I want to support it because I think it has potential. But the thing is, the potential is fading away. You can't say it's realistic when I can add 80 million in cash to my team's bank with real money. When the club needs money, it's the BOARD that gives it. Not the MANAGER. You can't market the game as realistic when these kind of stuff are in the game. I get so annoyed when a game has so much potential, but then they blow it.I think it's a 5/10 game. You can try the game out yourself if you want to. It's not bad, but the points I mentioned above make it fall to the below-average category.As for me, I'll stick with FM.

												Before taking anything into consideration, one must take into account that there's literally no reason to play this if you can afford to buy Football Manager, as it's better in anything you can think about... except price, of course. This does give Soccer Manager a solid niche as the poor man's football management game, and it does not do bad in that regard.Now, let's get to the game itself.Pros:+ If you ever played FM (Especially up to FM09), you'll be able to navigate quite easily.+ Extremely lightweight. You could teach Sports Interactive a thing or two in that regard :P+ Wide league selection. Nothing near FM, of course, but bigger than several not-free football games. *glares at FIFA and PES*+ The microtransactions are not intrusive at all.Neutral:~ I'd take the splash screen out of this version, to be frank. I would simply replace it with some "Login with Facebook" option available in every screen, but not a dedicated screen for it.~ There is no option to create customized formations, but I can give it a pass. It's not easy (In terms of it being reflected in the engine. If Football Manager can struggle, then why not this?) and... I guess it has to be portable and multiplatform.~ It's not exactly the most realistic thing in the world. Mostly comparable to FM Mobile. Expect some crazy moves... but it can add in the flavor.Negative:- Somehow the game does not look as well at 1366x768 than in 2015. For instance, I have to scroll down in the tactics screen to see the entire pitch.- There are several interface issues that were not fixed from 2015. Several "intuitive" actions that cannot be done. For instance, you cannot pick players from the squad screen, and you cannot sort players by star rating in the tactics screen. There are others, but I want to keep this short: The number of clicks that are necessary to perform an action should be reduced. And add some kind of indicator for hyperlinks in news posts.- Some leagues have the wrong format. For instance, Argentina uses 20 teams and no average point system instead of 30 and average points.- The Copa Sudamericana does not exist, and the Libertadores uses the same format as the Sudamericana.- The translations are a loooooong way to go.tl;dr What I said at first - good if you cannot have FM. Stay away otherwise. The story *could* be different on mobile platforms, but I can't test that.
